title: Exploring In-Situ Synthesis of Composite Nanostructures with Carbon-Based Materials using Open-Atmosphere set-up
content: The realm of carbon nanomaterials presents remarkable electrical and physical properties, offering revolutionary prospects for a wide array of applications [1-3]. However, achieving large-scale, cost-effective production methods remains a formidable challenge, particularly for innovative carbon nanomaterials like graphene [3]. This paper undertakes a pioneering exploration of flame synthesis techniques for carbon nanomaterials within an open-atmosphere processing framework, focusing primarily on processing and characterization techniques as well as morphologies.
